content: pig all in one amigurumi pattern by criss wall i had a huge collection of half balls of yarn i really wanted to use them instead of throwing them out so i started crocheting small toys to leave around for people to find they turned out to be so popular i just can t stop making them plus everyone keeps giving me yarn to make more so i now have more yarn than i originally started with… lol i know that there are some lovely pig patterns out there already but some of them take quite a while to finish i wanted to create a small series of patterns that take around 30-40 mins to complete and do not involve sewing additional parts onto the work my pattern contains basic instructions meant for someone who is already familiar crocheting amigurumi notes  try to use the smallest hook you can for this pattern this will help the pig keep its shape  i like to use a 3 5mm or 4mm hook with 10 ply/aran yarn with or a 3 0mm or 3 5mm 8ply/dk  they measure around 10cm long and 5cm high  i used about 25-27 metres of yarn for each pig  you will need to keep track of the start and finish of each row in this pattern the feet and ears are placed in certain stitches in the row stitches  chain  single_crochet single_crochet  half_double_crochet half_double_crochet  double_crochet double_crochet  treble_crochet treble_crochet  increase increase  decrease decrease  5dc bobble where you make a bobble with 5 double_crochet 6 loops on your hook  picot three chain and slip_stitch into the back of the first chain  front loop work in the front loop stitch only  back loop work in the back loop stitch only criss wall https //www ravelry com/patterns/library/all-in-one-pig-amigurumi instructions tail chain 13 slip_stitch in second chain from the hook and single_crochet in every chain back to the beginning excluding the last chain row 1 will start in the last chain place a stitch marker or use a piece of yarn to mark the end of the tail this pattern begins with the tail but if you find the start difficult you can easily substitute a magic_ring with 6 single_crochet and begin from there when you have completed a few row just tie your tail in after row 1 single_crochet 6 into the last chain from tail 6 stitches if you crochet over two strands of the starting chain it makes a smaller hole these 6 single_crochet s are the start of the pig s rump continue with row 2 without joining the tail needs to be bent towards you so the first single_crochet of row 2 will need to be behind the tail row 2 *increase in every single_crochet* repeat around 12 stitches row 3 *increase in next single_crochet single_crochet 1* repeat around 18 stitches row 4 *increase in next single_crochet single_crochet 2* repeat around 24 stitches
